KernelTeam/ReleaseStatus/LucidTasks Serv.status: Ensure we have good support for common servers.

work_items.description: Investigate top 10 selling units

foundations-lucid-upstart-server-review.name: foundations-lucid-upstart-server-review
foundations-lucid-upstart-server-review.status: There are a number of ways in which the boot-time behavior of karmic on server is worse than in previous releases as a result of the partial conversion to event-based upstart jobs.  We need to collate these issues and ensure these can be addressed appropriately for Ubuntu 10.04 LTS.

server-lucid-asterisk-integration.name: server-lucid-asterisk-integration
server-lucid-asterisk-integration.status: It would be extremely impressive if Ubuntu could provide a simple PABX and VoIP set-up out of the box. It will undermine use of Skype (Chinese censorship; closed protocol), and have the added benefit of giving users voicemail, and VoIP from a phone handset.

server-lucid-cluster-stack.name: server-lucid-cluster-stack
server-lucid-cluster-stack.status: Even though Ubuntu offers couple of cluster stacks in its archives, ubuntu-ha team feels that we should define one or two stacks for high availability and load balancing clusters. In the open source world there's an intention on bringing most prominent cluster system more closer together, or in the end even merge them into one.

server-lucid-euca2ools.name: server-lucid-euca2ools
server-lucid-euca2ools.status:
Euca2ools are the preferred command line clients for UEC.

There are some improvements that could be made to these, those include, but are not limited to:

 * config file based configuration (as opposed to .eucarc/environment)

 *  --region support for euca2ools (I [smoser] believe that euca2ools do not support '--region' but rather only re-setting EC2_URL. i could be wrong).
